subject: Re: [junit] Integration Interference.
msgSnippet: Unit testing & integration testing are two different things. Though, a good & thorough Unit testing is usually close to an integration test. Aim are however
messageBody:
Unit testing & integration testing are two different things.
Though, a good & thorough Unit testing is usually close to an
integration test.
Aim are however different...
Every subsystem may be perfectly coherent, it's however not sufficient
(a bit like philosophical thoughts :-)) ) to have every step right !

Thomas,


========
selena su wrote:
>
> Hi There:
> I have some questions here: Is that possible, JUnit can test the
> classes integration interference ? Another words, if one updated class
> is integrated to the production machine, how do i ensure this class is
> working fine with other classes in the production machine, is JUnit will
> be able to trace the integration problems ? If yes, how does it works ?
> Is there any documentation ?
> I was trying to find any documentation that was actually help me on
> this, but i couldn't find either ! :(.
>
> thanks,
>
